revised_title: Effects of Salts and Non-Electrolytes on Fructose Solutions
tldr: The author investigates the impact of salts and non-electrolytes on fructose solutions, observing changes in optical activity and suggesting that these substances affect the equilibrium of fructose in solution. The study finds that alcohols promote the formation of fructodextrose, while salts and other substances may form compounds with sugar, altering the solution's properties.
